titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Lynne Sagalyn Research Files for "Power at Ground Zero"
19xx-2xxxx
MS 3128
titlestmt.author: [You, or earlier authors]

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:19:14 -0400.

did.unittitle: Lynne Sagalyn research files for "Power at Ground Zero"
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to 20 exposures of stable, unbound material per day.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: Lynne Sagalyn research files for "Power at Ground Zero", MS 3128, New-York Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TBD

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Episode," or E series files include newspaper articles (clippings, tear sheets, print-outs from newspaper websites or other on-line sources), miscellaneous primary and secondary materials (press releases, magazine articles), and some notes by Sagalyn related to various aspects of Ground Zero redevelopment. These include the design considerations and debates,

did.unittitle: EO. July leasehold sale to investor group
E4. 9/11 Real Estate; E5. 9/11 Rebound (over time)
E6. Designs I; E7. Designs RFP II
E9. New York Times Design Initiative

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See also WTC Commercial Design Guidelines document in Box X.

did.unittitle: E12. Libeskind Master Plan, including Implementation Struggles (slurry wall) (2 folders)
E15. Transit Building – Temporary PATH Station Rebuilding (Church Street)
E19. Permanent Calatrava and PATH Station Design (2 folders)
E16. Expanding the Site (Deutsche Bank Building); E16b. 130 Liberty Deconstruction / Fire (2 folders)
E20. Freedom Tower Design (> Dec 16, 2003) / E24 Freedom Tower Redesign, Architects Battle (2003)
E25. Cultural Buildings and Dissembling Events
E25. Cultural Buildings and Dissembling Events / RB6. Rebuilding: Cultural
E27. Goldman Sachs Deal and Building; E28. Cortland & Dey Streets Debate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See also Series V. Rebuilding Files for the related 2005 Goldman Sachs lease document.

did.unittitle: E30. Power struggle: Bloomberg's calls and criticism of Silverstein
E31. Pataki Deadline / Lease Renegotiations / Conflict leading to Episode E34
E32. PA takeover of project's construction management / PA problems with delivery of sites; E35. Paterson Timetable / News of Ward Reports
E37. St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church resolution / deal collapse
E40. Port Authority / Silverstein Financing Conflict
E41. The "stumps" – podium; E 44. Third Amended to the Port Authority-Silverstein deal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See also E10-10.

did.unittitle: E50. Merrill Lynch/JP Morgan potential tenancy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Greenwich Street/Courtlandt Way, PATH Terminal, Tower 4, Memorial Museum, Liberty Park, and Miscellany.

did.unittitle: Transit Hall articles and critique materials used for epilogue
Series II. Port Authority of New York and New Jersey (PANYNJ)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes primary documents related to the Port Authority, including Board resolutions, committee minutes, legal opinions, memorandums, reports created by the Port Authority and others, arbitration decisions, press releases, etc. While some material relates to the Port Authority generally, much if not most of this relates specifically to the rebuilding of the World Trade Center transportation hub and to chapter 15 (Transportation Phoenix) in Lynne Sagalyn's book. Primary documents also include summaries of interviews conducted by Sagalyn. The series also includes Sagalyn's chronologies, notes, article logs, and other work product based on these documents.

did.unittitle: Two States in the Board Room

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents underlying part of Chapter 4. Includes articles, etc. dated 1979-2000, with Sagalyn's 2013 chronology and log of WTC sale/privatization articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes repors from Bear Stearns, Chemical Securities, legal analyses, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Board resolutions, agreements, memorandums of understanding (MOU), and other materials from 1993-2015. Also, includes Sagalyn's summary of actions at PANYNJ board meetings of October 2006-April 2009.

did.unittitle: Commissioner Anthony Sartor voting record & related documents (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Sagalyn's 2015 log of Sartor's voting record, 2001-13, with underlying documents: Board material for Downtown Restoration Program, 2001-13, and Committee of Operations, 2009-14.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sagalyn's notes, chronologies, news and articles log and analysis, with underlying source documents, related to Chapter 15.

did.unittitle: Reports: "World Trade Center Assessment" and "World Trade Center Report: A Roadmap Forward"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Sagalyn's chronologies, notes, article log, analyses, and interview notes, with underlying source documents, including among many others the Hub Working Group Steering Committee Final Report of September 25, 2008 and arbitration-related material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Sagalyn's notes and transcripts from Board meetings in 2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an audit of PANYNJ employee compensation plans (1980), audit report regarding toll increases (1981), PA Bus Terminal investment analysis (1999), financial statement for 2001, and official statement for Series UU notes (2003).

did.unittitle: Series III. Lower Manhattan Development Corporation (LMDC)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes materials that center on the development of downtown, most especially as it related to the role of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation (LMDC). Documents include press releases and other documents produced by or about the LMDC; planning and redevelopment-related documents, such as the World Trade Center General Project Plan (GPP)and Environmental Impact Statement (EIS); and Sagalyn's notes, chronlogies, and other work product related to the source material.

did.unittitle: New York City Department of City Planning (DCP) / Deputy Mayor Daniel Doctoroff
City Council Committee on Lower Manhattan Redevelopment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Committee meeting briefing papers and summaries prepared by Sagalyn and research assistants.

did.unittitle: Transcript of minutes of the City Council's Committee on Lower Manhattan Redevelopment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes by-laws, webpage and other print-outs of LMDC Board member biographies and other organizational information, and speeches by its executive officers. Also includes a list of LMDC Board minutes available online through 2011 and a CD labeled "LMDC minutes."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes overview, chronology and other material prepared by Sagalyn's research assistant. Includes a CD of documents downloaded by the RA, with a summary list in the file and some print-outs, including speeches and Committee briefing papers. See also Episode E16b in Series I.

did.unittitle: P13b. Players: Lower Manhattan Construction Command Center (LMCCC)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes notes from one interview, with other documents, mostly news articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a few releases for 2002-05, but a log of releases for 2001-11 prepared by Sagalyn.

did.unittitle: PP2. Plans & Planners: Process - General (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to the performing arts/cultural center; a summary of community development block grants; LMDC/PANYNJ brochure re: design studies (2002); an agreement between the city and PANYNJ re: World Trade Center PILOT (payments in lieu of taxes) and re: design guidelines (both 2006); and various correspondence re: Sagalyn's requests.

did.unittitle: LMDC Chronology: WTC Rebuilding Effort, 2001-2013 (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Sagalyn's chronology, cross-referenced to source documents found in various files. This file holds certain documents from 2002-05.

did.unittitle: World Trade Center General Project Plan (GPP). including amendments, and Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) materials (3 folders)
World Trade Center Generic Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) (2 folders)
Series IV. Commercial Real Estate and Silverstein Properties

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes documents centered on the rebuilding of the World Trade Center towers, especially as it related to the involvement of developer Larry Silverstein and Silverstein Properties. Documents include agreements with Silverstein-related entities; media clips about Silverstein; and news articles, other published material, and presentations about commercial real estate and its economic prospects in lower Manhattan post-9/11.

did.unittitle: P14. Players: Silverstein Properties. Various documents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the interim access agreement between the Port Authority and various World Trade Center limited liability companies (LLCs), 2002; legal and other documents regarding leases and easements, 2003-07; news articles, 1987-13; public statements by Larry Silverstein; and Sagalyn work product, including notes, interview questions, and media log, 2001-14

did.unittitle: Silverstein Properties. Media clippings and presentations (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two packets of media clips from Silverstein Properties; slides of a presentation "Building for the Future" by John N. (Janno) Lieber of Silverstein; and a press packet, with CD, of materials titled "Completing the Vision" in connection with the unveiling of WTC designs by architects Norman Foster, Fumihiko Maki, and Richard Rodgers (2006).

did.unittitle: World Trade Center deal realignment materials (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes NYC Economic Development Corporation's WTC Summary of Financial Analysis presentation to the City Council, with Sagalyn notes; letters from Silverstein properties to the Port Authority; the NYC Independent Budget Office's analysis of anticipated demand for space in a rebuilt WTC site; Port Authority board documents; master development agreement; and articles and Sagalyn media log.

did.unittitle: RB5. Rebuilding: Commercial real estate (5 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes McKinsey's 2002 PowerPoint report "Revitalizing Lower Manhattan" to the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation; a report by Hugh F. Kelly for the Civic Alliance on downtown office prospects after 9/11; published reports by Cushman & Wakefield and others; and news articles/clippings.

did.unittitle: RB5-1. Rebuilding: Commercial real estate: Freedom Tower / 1 World Trade Center (4 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a set of documents concerning the development and management of the 1 WTC observation deck, including the Request for Proposal (RFP) and lease with Legends Owo, LLC; Port Authority Board authorization of a joint venture with the Durst Organization; articles and clippings; and some Sagalyn and research assistant notes.

did.unittitle: RB5-2 through RB5-5. Rebuilding: Commercial real estate: Sites 2, 3, 4, 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes

did.unittitle: RB4. Transportation (Mass transit, Hard rail). Reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes news clippings and work product of Sagalyn and a research assistant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Sagalyn and research assistant article abstracts and chronology, as well as many clippngs and articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes, among clippings and other print matter, a CD of Sagalyn's 2005 paper/talk at the Wharton (UPenn) Real Estate Department on "The Politics of Planning the World's Most Visible Urban Redevelopment Project" and a CD of the 2002 Urban Land Institute fall meeting on "New York One Year Later."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes, among clippings and other documents, transcripts of panel discussions on "Building in the Aftermath of 9/11" held in 2002 at the National Buiding Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes, with print matter, Sagalyn and research assistant work product including chronology and accounting of the $8 billion bond authorization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Port Authority Board documents related to joint venture agreements with Westfield America Limited Partnership and Westfield Ameruca Inc., with Sagalyn research assistant notes and other print matter.

did.unittitle: RB25. Legal issues (other than insurance; includes allegations of fraud)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Sagalyn and research assistant work product summarizing WTC disputes/litigation. Includes some print-outs of articles and CD of Summer 2010 WTC articles.

did.unittitle: RB27. Environmental; RB29. WTC Utility Restoration & Infrastructure Rebuilding Program (as amended August 2004)
RB30. Construction Technical Achievements and Mishaps, including underground; RB39. Fiterman Hall
Battery Park City Authority lease to Goldman Sachs Headquarters LLC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes lease for development of trading and office space, as submitted with Goldman Sachs Form 8-K of August 23, 2005, with related documents.
